info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH INTENSE LIGHTNING AND TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN MCDOWELL...NORTHEASTERN BUNCOMBE AND SOUTH CENTRAL YANCEY COUNTIES UNTIL 330 PM EDT... At 254 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with intense lightning and torrential rainfall 13 miles east of Downtown Asheville, or near Black Mountain, moving northeast at 5 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Black Mountain, Swannanoa, Old Fort, B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, Mount Mitchell State Park, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland and Montreat. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. If outdoors, try to get indoors or into a hard topped vehicle. Otherwise, stay away from open areas and isolated high objects such as trees. When indoors, stay away from windows and doors and avoid using wired electronic devices. Do not take a shower or bath. Try to unplug unnecessary appliances before the storm approaches.
